abstract: Richard C. Levin, Yale’s president, said in a letter to the university’s faculty that Yale could be facing a $100 million shortfall in the 2009 school year.
snippet: Richard C. Levin, Yale’s president, said in a letter to the university’s faculty that Yale could be facing a $100 million shortfall in the 2009 school year.
lead_paragraph: Yale disclosed Tuesday that its endowment had fallen at least 13.4 percent in the four months since June as the decline in asset values during the financial crisis takes its toll on another university.
